pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Individual wall segments instead of polylines

content.raw:
I noticed some changes in behavior I am not sure if they're intended:

- walls no longer snap to 90 degrees while being drawn

- when trying to close the walls, the end points no longer auto snap together.

- when moving the wall segment by the grabber handle, snapping to fixed angle increments is off

- sometimes double clicking to end wall drawing opens the wall inspector
content.html:
I noticed some changes in behavior I am not sure if they're intended:

  • walls no longer snap to 90 degrees while being drawn

  • when trying to close the walls, the end points no longer auto snap together.

  • when moving the wall segment by the grabber handle, snapping to fixed angle increments is off

  • sometimes double clicking to end wall drawing opens the wall inspector

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Individual wall segments instead of polylines

content.raw:
Oh sorry, I thought of separating these changes into another PR but they ended up here.

Talking to @spaepcke, we thought it might be better to have snapping off by default. Holding `Shift` turns snapping on; on draw mode, snapping goes to the closest end point, and if there are no close points, to multiples of 45. When moving the grabber handle, holding shift snaps to multiples of 45 only (because I haven't implemented the other snapping there yet).
content.html:
Oh sorry, I thought of separating these changes into another PR but they ended up here.

Talking to @spaepcke, we thought it might be better to have snapping off by default. Holding Shift turns snapping on; on draw mode, snapping goes to the closest end point, and if there are no close points, to multiples of 45. When moving the grabber handle, holding shift snaps to multiples of 45 only (because I haven't implemented the other snapping there yet).

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Individual wall segments instead of polylines

content.raw: I may be misremembering, but here's what I recall from our decisions: I thought it would be good to require a hot key for snapping, because (in my experience) that's more standard. Illustrator, for example, doesn't snap unless you hold a hot key. We'll need to add a tool tip/hint for that somewhere. I can't for the life of me remember why we reevaluated snapping...there was something else that could snap, but it didn't make sense to snap by default. What was that? I remember not wanting walls to snap by default, while this other thing does not snap by default...
content.html: I may be misremembering, but here's what I recall from our decisions: I thought it would be good to require a hot key for snapping, because (in my experience) that's more standard. Illustrator, for example, doesn't snap unless you hold a hot key. We'll need to add a tool tip/hint for that somewhere. I can't for the life of me remember why we reevaluated snapping...there was something else that could snap, but it didn't make sense to snap by default. What was that? I remember not wanting walls to snap by default, while this other thing does not snap by default...

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Individual wall segments instead of polylines

content.raw:
We were talking about snapping to XY (issue #408) and you said to have it off by default and on with a hotkey. Then I said it was the opposite behaviour from the angular snapping, so you said it might be best to have them all turn on with the hotkey. 

Somewhere you had also mentioned to snap to 45 degrees instead of 90... I've been using this branch for a while, and I would suggest changing it to 15 instead, like it is when grabbing on the default branch.
content.html:
We were talking about snapping to XY (issue #408) and you said to have it off by default and on with a hotkey. Then I said it was the opposite behaviour from the angular snapping, so you said it might be best to have them all turn on with the hotkey.

Somewhere you had also mentioned to snap to 45 degrees instead of 90... I've been using this branch for a while, and I would suggest changing it to 15 instead, like it is when grabbing on the default branch.

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Individual wall segments instead of polylines

content.raw:
Aaah thanks. @iche033, do you think it's too inconvenient to prevent angular snapping without a hot key? 

15˚ sounds good.
content.html:
Aaah thanks. @iche033, do you think it's too inconvenient to prevent angular snapping without a hot key?

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Individual wall segments instead of polylines

content.raw:
Opening this issue again after discussion with Nate. Issue #408 is separate enough from wall snapping that it's okay for the interactions to be different. It really is easier to draw something if the walls snap (15 degrees) by default. Let's revert (again) to that so that holding Shift while drawing lets the user draw without constraints. @chapulina , what do you think of also snapping the wall length to .25 meter increments? This would get overwritten (along with angle snapping) using Shift. Not a high priority right now. 

Is the XY constraints in the 2D view implemented already?
content.html:
Opening this issue again after discussion with Nate. Issue #408 is separate enough from wall snapping that it's okay for the interactions to be different. It really is easier to draw something if the walls snap (15 degrees) by default. Let's revert (again) to that so that holding Shift while drawing lets the user draw without constraints. @chapulina , what do you think of also snapping the wall length to .25 meter increments? This would get overwritten (along with angle snapping) using Shift. Not a high priority right now.

Is the XY constraints in the 2D view implemented already?

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Individual wall segments instead of polylines

content.raw:
Sure, I can make a new pull request reverting this. Just to make sure, the snapping priority is to another wall nearby, in case there's none, to 15 degrees, right?

Snapping to .25 m sounds useful, maybe we can open a minor issue?

I played around with the XY constraints but haven't finished it, I'll see if there's little left to do and make a pr if that's the case.
content.html:
Sure, I can make a new pull request reverting this. Just to make sure, the snapping priority is to another wall nearby, in case there's none, to 15 degrees, right?

Snapping to .25 m sounds useful, maybe we can open a minor issue?

I played around with the XY constraints but haven't finished it, I'll see if there's little left to do and make a pr if that's the case.

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Individual wall segments instead of polylines

content.raw:
Each wall segment has 2 grabbers, 0 is on the start point, 1 on the end. 

Here we're snapping the end point of the segment being drawn to either the start point (line 348) or end point (line 357) of an existing segment.
content.html:
Each wall segment has 2 grabbers, 0 is on the start point, 1 on the end.

Here we're snapping the end point of the segment being drawn to either the start point (line 348) or end point (line 357) of an existing segment.

content.raw: You can use: `double angle = GZ_DTOR(QLineF(p1, p2).angle());`, and remove the preceding line. Also use `GZ_DTOR` for the next line.

content.raw: Division by `2` is ever so slightly risky. If `range` is ever changed to be an `int`, then the result of the division will be incorrect. You could instead multiply by 0.5, or divide by `2.0`.
content.html: Division by 2 is ever so slightly risky. If range is ever changed to be an int, then the result of the division will be incorrect. You could instead multiply by 0.5, or divide by 2.0.
